required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety Study of a New Leuprolide Acetate 17 mg Depot to Treat Prostate Cancer Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy and Safety of a New Leuprolide Acetate 17 mg Depot Formulation, GP-Pharm S.A., When Given as Palliative Treatment to Prostate Cancer Patients

brief_summary.textblock: This is a multi-center, open-label study of 2 doses of leuprolide acetate 17 mg depot, administered three months apart, in subjects with prostate cancer who might benefit from medical androgen deprivation therapy

primary_outcome.measure: Percent of successful patients achieving chemical castration

secondary_outcome.measure: plasma testosterone concentration (ng/mL) in PK population
Plasma leuprolide concentrations (pg/mL) in PK population

arm_group.description: leuprolide acetate administered by i.m. injection as two doses of 17 mg each during a period of 6 months (one dose every 3 months)
